title: When debugging onKeyDown , the onChange event does not fire, but fires when not debugging
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**
bug

**What is the current behavior?**
when the input text has onKeyDown listener as well as onChange listener, the onChange listener isn't called when debugging if there is a breakpoint on switch(event.key) in onKeyDown (tested in chrome console, chrome version v71). It works well otherwise (if the breakpoint is at some other line , or no breakpoint in onKeyDown)

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem. Your bug will get fixed much faster if we can run your code and it doesn't have dependencies other than React. Paste the link to your JSFiddle (https://jsfiddle.net/Luktwrdm/) or CodeSandbox (https://codesandbox.io/s/new) example below:**
https://codesandbox.io/s/1yp35l2z54

**What is the expected behavior?**
onChange should be fired whether we are debugging or not.

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**
React - v16.0.0 on sandbox, also happens with v16.7.0-alpha on local.
Chrome v71
Windows

I have created a video of me trying to debug it , can't seem to attach the video, so here is a poor quality gif
![ezgif-1-cfc1584459db](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12510548/52216384-13a42d00-28bc-11e9-900c-4b32b35aa08c.gif)
